data.title: Added map revision property.
data.body: Downloading multiple revisions make map choice confusing for host and players. This fixes the problem with an optional Revision property.

data.title: Remove beacons when the badgers get shot down
data.body: Should fix #6184 .

data.title: Add Civillian Structures (City01 up to City22) [Part1]
data.body:
- Add Civillian Structures City01 up to City22
- None of these Structures is Buildable atm (Buildable Key removed)

data.title: Add sequences for City01 - City22 [Part 1]
data.body: - Add sequences for "City01" up to "City22"

data.title: Objectives fine-tuning
data.body: This PR is a response to the latest comments in #6377, and should facilitate the requested changes.

data.title: Move utility commands into the mod assemblies.
data.body: #6289 plus fixes for the review comments.  This is the first in a (long) series of dependencies for the next set of TS engine work, so I would like to see this feature merged before the next release.

data.title: Added my Name "Guido Lipke" under Section "Thanks to"
data.body: Added my Name "Guido Lipke" under Section "Thanks to"

data.title: Game crashes when (one) Map(s) contains invalid Data
data.body:
I had tried to change the Map size of the Testmap from "128,128" to "130,130"
The Game chrashed with Exception "The Map contains invalid Data"

The Exception is thrown in file:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/Minimap.cs

At Line: 37         var mapTiles = map.MapTiles.Value;

It Seems when we have 4 maps and one of these Maps contains invalid Data, the game will crash :(
We should "ignore or skip" this Map and notice the User about this "invalid Map Data" instead of Crashing to Desktop :( and proceed the Next Map
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4460347-game-crashes-when-one-map-s-contains-invalid-data?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: [TS] Fix Shroud revealing on Structures (PROC, GALIGHT)
data.body:
- PROC doesnt reveal shroud enough:
  In my "research i had found that all Structures have "Xc0" style as Value but PROC has only "6" instead of "6c0" after chainging the Value to 6c0,
- GALIGHT: increase Shroud reveal value from "0c0" at least "2c0":
  Also i had noticed that GALIGHT is covered under the Shroud when it is placed on the map. 
  I gave it 2c0 instead of 0c0 -> so it is not covered by the shroud, when it is placed by the Player side

data.title: Added return values for "Timeout" and "DNS" Errors
data.body:
Added Return value for:
- WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure: "DNS lookup failed"
- WebExceptionStatus.Timeout: "Connection timeout"

data.title: AI no longer calls support power on things it can't target
data.body:
This makes the AI take into consideration whether or not it can target a unit when considering how attractive a target it is for its support power - if it can't be targetted then it's not considered.

I tested this change by creating a large number of stealth tanks and having them sat clumped together as bait - when cloaked the AI didn't air strike them and instead chose another target. When uncloaked (I made them force fire on a bit of terrain) it saw them and air striked them (as they were by far the most obvious target).

I think this will make it a bit more fun to use stealth tanks against the AI - it decimated my stealth tanks the other day and I was a little bit displeased (╯°□°)╯︵ ┻━┻

data.title: Removed obsolete legacy explosion sequences from TD mod
data.body: Except for '6' (nuke mushroom) they weren't used anymore anyway.

data.title: Use the current selected terrain Palette from the selected Map.
data.body:
Use the current selected terrain Palette from the defined Tileset in the Map. 
- The Tileset is defined in "map.yaml" at "Tileset:"
- The color palette is defined in the "<Tileset>.yaml" at "Palette:"

data.title: [tested] missing notifications and the SNOW theater file
data.body:
I had found, that the two notifications, "DisablePower" and "EnablePower" has no sounds assosiated: Im on Linux and cant extract the Mix, maybe someone can explain me how to open these Mix files... so that i can support...: in file : /mods/ts/notifications.yaml under "Sounds: -> Notifications:" DisablePower: 00-i232 # Building offline... EnablePower: 00-i230 # Building online... and in the same file under "Speech: -> Notifications:" NoBuild: 00-i064 # unable to complete, building in Progress... #### Snow terain: for my testing i had created the file (by coping temperat.yaml) /mods/ts/tilesets/snow.yaml with the following content: 
General:
    Name: Snow
    Id: SNOW
    Extensions: .sno, .shp
    Palette: isosnow.pal
    EditorTemplateOrder: Placeholder

Terrain:
    TerrainType@Clear:
        Type: Clear
        AcceptsSmudgeType: Crater, Scorch
        Color: 116, 85, 55
        TargetTypes: Ground
    TerrainType@Tiberium:
        Type: Tiberium
        AcceptsSmudgeType: Crater, Scorch
        Color: 161, 226, 28
        TargetTypes: Ground
    TerrainType@BlueTiberium:
        Type: BlueTiberium
        AcceptsSmudgeType: Crater, Scorch
        Color: 28, 64, 248
        TargetTypes: Ground

Templates:
    Template@255:
        Id: 255
        Image: clear01
        Size: 1,1
        Category: Placeholder
        Tiles:
            0: Clear
and changed the "tileset" entry in the map files to "SNOW" -> works but the right color is to be set :)

data.title: Move rpm and arch packaging downstream
data.body:
These two platforms have a lot in common with respect to OpenRA:
- They have active community-maintained repositories that already include higher-quality OpenRA packages than what our automated build can provide.
- They have very few direct downloads from the website (around 1% or less of all downloads).
- They are disproportionately difficult for us to package:
  - We need to compile pkgbuild from source as part the packaging scripts.
  - We need to ship consistently-named libraries in the rpm because the different distros use different library names (and mono doesn't support multiple alternatives).

I would like to remove rpm and pkgbuild from our automated packaging script (`make install` would be unaffected) so that we can simplify and focus it on our three platforms that don't have a strong community-distribution channel.  We would keep the platform icons on the download page, but they would direct users to the downstream distribution channel like we already do for Gentoo.

See also #4248.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4430018-move-rpm-and-arch-packaging-downstream?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Disabled WithDeathAnimation for TS visceroids
data.body: Closes #6476.

data.title: Hunterseeker: Players should be able to select the type of Target :)
data.body:
At the time of Develompment of Tiberian Sun, there worse a feature planned to select the TargetType for the HunterSeeker. In Documentations of old planned and droped features but mainly for releasetime reasons, that feature worse never Implemented.

The Hunterseeker chooses randomly andalso mainly "stealthed" and by a value that is given in the rules.ini, its target, this leads to various BUGS

For example (also the ION Cannon warhead is affected by this stealth bug!)
1. Player deploys limpeds somewhere on the Map
2. Other Player launch the HunterSeeker, the Haunterseeker will go straitaway to the deployed Limped instead of hitting another Target, the problem is the priority that is choosen and Calculated by a value in the Rules.ini from the Game itself.

Player should have an option to Decide what target shoud be choosen for example:
A Message Box should popup where the Player can choose the following Modes:
Also the Audio voice "select target" can be used for that (MessageBox) "question"
/----------------------------------------------------------\
Select Target! 

Select the Target what should be bla bla....

[ Buildings]  [ Infantry ] [ random (game logic) ] [ aircraft ]
-----------------------------------------------------------/
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4423241-hunterseeker-players-should-be-able-to-select-the-type-of-target?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Updating outdated maps
data.body:
Two maps included in package was slightly outdated. I have took into consideration, that in Poland Raid there was added 'AllowBots: False' directives for known reasons.
## blitzkrieg changes:

() added some resource mines in order to improve battle dynamic
## poland raid changes: <screenshot below>

1(!) corrected bridge repair issue from south
2 added north passage for top-right player (now every player has 2 passages)
3 more space for bot-right player (balancing)
4 less space for bot player (balancing)
5 wider passage at left-bot (facilitate moving-through for bigger groups of units)
6a/b/c added oil rigs (making mid islands more interesting)

![poland-raid-v5b-changes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4294959/e8b6f0d0-3de4-11e4-876f-993ac6fab1c8.png)

minor rules: slighty reduced dig time for oil mines as bonus becouse there are only 3 of them located on map in remarkable areas
slighty increased main factory reveal range to match map layout

dynamic preview changes gif
![poland-raid-changes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4294958/e8ac907c-3de4-11e4-9d2c-dfbd50bb3148.gif)

data.title: Experience/Level/Upgrades not carried over when transforming
data.body: I noticed this while working on elite weapons. All the above information is lost when a tick tank deploys, for example.

data.title: Fix for stealth tanks needing cloak upgrade
data.body: This fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6448 by making it so that stealth tanks don't require a crate pickup to be able to cloak.

data.title: Add chat tab to end-game dialog
data.body: Also removes the stats button from single-player games, since I feel that it does not belong there.

data.title: Prevent LuaException when querying a dead actor's traits in TriggerGlobal
data.body:
Fixes #6454 
#6377 adds another method to this file which also needs to be fixed this way. Depending on the order these two PRs will be merged, one has to be modified accordingly.

data.title: Added functionality and descriptions to Missile projectile
data.body: Added a LockOnProbability, turned MissileCloseEnough from a hack into a feature, and added some descriptions.

data.title: Adds EliteWeapon to Armament
data.body: Replaces default Weapon with EliteWeapon once a specific experience level has been reached/passed.
